subject: Cybersecurity
title: Ransomware as a Service: Crime Goes Corporate
description: A 60-second lesson on Ransomware as a Service: Crime Goes Corporate.

hook.text: You don't need to know how to hack anymore. You can rent ransomware like a subscription service.

buildup.text: RaaS platforms let anyone launch attacks. Developers take a cut of the ransom. Affiliates do the hacking.

discovery.text: Groups like REvil and LockBit operate like businesses with customer support, SLAs, and revenue sharing.

twist.text: Some even have 'ethics' â€” refusing to attack hospitals. Crime has developed its own twisted corporate culture.

climax.text: RaaS lowered the barrier to entry so far that cybercrime is now a trillion-dollar global industry.

punchline.text: Cybercrime has a better business model than most startups.

quiz.question: What does RaaS stand for in cybersecurity?
